metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1244 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The extractTree function in unADF allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via shell metacharacters in a directory name in an adf file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

unadf - 0.7.11a-3+deb7u1~build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unadf package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.11a-3+deb7u1~build0.14.04.1').
